p: Coronaviruses are well known pathogens of the family Coronaviridae. They are enveloped viruses with a single-strand positive-sense RNA genome of 26â€“32 kilobases in size ( Schoeman & Fielding, 2019). According to genetic criteria they have been divided into three groups, alfa, beta and gamma coronaviruses. They can infect also other animals, like birds and mammals. Alpha and beta coronaviruses are of particular interest because these strains can infect mammals and occasionally can cross the species barrier and become human pathogens ( Schoeman & Fielding, 2019).
